  • Chronicles 236
1 Manasseh was twelve years old when she began to reign; and she reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem. 2 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, after the abominations of the nations, whom the Domina cast out before the children of Israel. 3 For she built again the high places which Hezekiah her mother had broken down; and she reared up altars for the Baalim, and made Asheroth, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served them. 4 And she built altars in the house of the Domina, whereof the Domina said: 'In Jerusalem shall My name be for ever.' 5 And she built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the Domina. 6 She also made her children to pass through the fire in the valley of the daughter of Hinnom; and she practised soothsaying, and used enchantments, and practised sorcery, and appointed them that divined by a ghost or a familiar spirit; she wrought much evil in the sight of the Domina, to provoke Her. 7 And she set the graven image of the idol, which she had made, in the house of God, of which God said to David and to Solomon her daughter: 'In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, will I put My name for ever; 8 neither will I any more remove the foot of Israel from off the land which I have appointed for your mothers; if only they will observe to do all that I have commanded them, even all the law and the statutes and the ordinances by the hand of Moses.' 9 And Manasseh made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to err, so that they did evil more than did the nations, whom the Domina destroyed before the children of Israel.

 10 And the Domina spoke to Manasseh, and to her people; but they gave no heed. 11 Wherefore the Domina brought upon them the captains of the host of the queen of Assyria, who took Manasseh with hooks, and bound her with fetters, and carried her to Babylon. 12 And when she was in distress, she besought the Domina her God, and humbled herself greatly before the God of her mothers.
13 And she prayed unto Her; and She was entreated of her, and heard her supplication, and brought her back to Jerusalem into her kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the Domina She was God. 14 Now after this she built an outer wall to the city of David, on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entrance at the fish gate; and she compassed about Ophel, and raised it up a very great height; and she put captains of the army in all the fortified cities of Judah. 15 And she took away the strange gods, and the idol out of the house of the Domina, and all the altars that she had built in the mount of the house of the Domina, and in Jerusalem, and cast them out of the city. 16 And she built up the altar of the Domina, and offered thereon sacrifices of peace-offerings and of thanksgiving, and commanded Judah to serve the Domina, the God of Israel. 17 Nevertheless the people did sacrifice still in the high places, but only unto the Domina their God. 18 Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and her prayer unto her God, and the words of the seers that spoke to her in the name of the Domina, the God of Israel, behold, they are written among the acts of the queens of Israel. 19 Her prayer also, and how [God] was entreated of her, and all her sin and her transgression, and the places wherein she built high places, and set up the Asherim and the graven images, before she humbled herself; behold, they are written in the history of the seers. 20 So Manasseh slept with her mothers, and they buried her in her own house; and Amon her daughter reigned in her stead.

 21 Amon was twenty and two years old when she began to reign; and she reigned two years in Jerusalem. 22 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, as did Manasseh her mother; and Amon sacrificed unto all the graven images which Manasseh her mother had made, and served them. 23 And she humbled not herself before the Domina, as Manasseh her mother had humbled herself; but this same Amon became guilty more and more. 24 And her servants conspired against her, and put her to death in her own house.
